qas.question: What is the Drosophila gene the cause of?
What is the Drosophila gene also known as?
What is Familial advanced sleep phase syndrome?
What kind of clock have genetic functions?

plausible_answers.text: as a specific time of the day

qas.question: How do cells of the body interpret fluctuations in light?
What does a defect in the period genome cause?

context: A defect in the human homologue of the <b5_0>Drosophila<b5_0/> "<a1_0>period<a1_0/>" gene was identified as a cause of the <a0_0>sleep disorder <a2_0><b8_0>FASPS<b8_0/><a2_0/><a0_0/> (Familial advanced sleep phase syndrome), underscoring the conserved nature of the molecular circadian clock through evolution. Many more genetic components of the <a3_0><b6_0>biological clock<b6_0/><a3_0/> are now known. Their interactions result in an interlocked feedback loop of gene products resulting in periodic fluctuations that the cells of the body interpret <b7_0>as a specific <a4_0>time of the day<b7_0/><a4_0/>.[citation needed]
